vialab.simpleMultiTouch.events

Class TuioEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • vialab.simpleMultiTouch.events.TuioEvent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArcBallEvent, DragEvent, HSwipeEvent, PinchEvent, RotateEvent, TapAndHoldEvent, TapEvent, VSwipeEvent

    public abstract class TuioEvent
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds the information associated with each type of event. This is the base event class which all the other events extend.

    University of Ontario Institute of Technology. Summer Research Assistant with Dr. Christopher Collins (Summer 2011) collaborating with Dr. Mark Hancock.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Erik Paluka

    • Constructor Detail

      • TuioEvent

        public TuioEvent(int x,
         int y,
         long[] cursors)
        Base constructor for all events. Saves the x and y coordinates of the event, and the cursors associated with this event (their session IDs).
        Parameters:
        x - int - X-coordinate of the event.
        y - int - Y-coordinate of the event.
        cursors - long[] - The cursors associated with this event (their session IDs).

    • Method Detail

      • handled

        public boolean handled()
        Gets the boolean value of the flag handled. Handled is set to true if the event has been handled.
        Returns:
        handled boolean

      • setHandled

        public void setHandled(boolean handled)
        Sets the boolean value of handled.
        Parameters:
        handled - boolean

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Gets the x-coordinate of the event.
        Returns:
        x int - X-coordinate of the event.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Gets the y-coordinate of the event.
        Returns:
        y int - Y-coordinate of the event.

      • getCursors

        public long[] getCursors()
        Gets the cursors associated with this event (their session IDs)
        Returns:
        cursors long[] - Array of session IDs
